channel.title: Computer borked
channel.description:
So here's what happened
[ul][li]went home for christmas and took my desktop computer with me in the boot of my uncles car. It was nice and snug in there so I doubt any damage was done in transportation.[/li] [li]Got home, hooked it all up, worked perfectly for about 2 days[/li] [li]after being afk a few hours i came back to a normal computer, after about 5 minutes it froze up and I had to restart. Everything was fine for another 5 minutes until I got a bsod "IRQL NOT LESS OR EQUAL"[/li] [li]This time when i turned it on windows 7 tried to find and repair the problem, after leaving it to "repair" for an hour i decided to give up and reboot again. This time i tried to boot in to my xp partition. Got to the desktop and it blue screened again with IRQL NOT LESS OR EQUAL. [/li][/ul]
I decide to leave it off for a few hours, perhaps it overheated. I come back to turn it on and it doesn't make the usual "bleep I've identified there's something in my usb socket etc", and my screens were not going on. I turned it off and tried changing around my monitors diagnostically. I then took out my 8800gts and tried using default graphics but that still didn't work. I took all the stuff out that I can and vacuumed all the dust off and put it all back in. Still not working. Tried it with 1 stick of ram in each slot, tried with 2...
tl;dr getting black screen when turning on computer, monitors not detecting. What else can I do?
p.s. I had 12 weeks of uni, in this time I saved all the games I wanted to play until I got to Christmas vacation. Vacation comes and my pc breaks. FUCKING FUCK MY FUCKING LIFE

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Ram is dead, atleast one of the modules.

inb4saiditalready.

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:18, topic:374586”][quote author=Niall link=topic=470549.msg3443246#msg3443246 date=1293217619]
I suggest:

resetting bios, if not
reseat the cpu and ram, if not
take out and connect everything again, I had the same bsod for a while and it turned out something was probably loose, haven’t had it since
[/quote]
Tried all those things :([/quote]

Then somethings probably borked.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

@moparisthebest wrote:

Yep, resetting CMOS would be the next step, but you already took care of that. Sorry for your loss…

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah my computer has made no beeps, also throughout all testing the red light on front of the case has been on constantly. Also tried resetting cmos.

so scan.co.uk for new mobo,cpu and ram

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Those scary beeps would be POST telling you you have no RAM

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:374586”]What does it do if you boot it without any RAM? It should at least show you the BIOS.[/quote]I used to have a computer that did nothing with no RAM, just made lots of scary beeps.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

What does it do if you boot it without any RAM? It should at least show you the BIOS.

Does nothing
I don’t even get any warning beeps, which Mopman says is a likely sign either cpu or motherboard is gone.

New motherboard + cpu for me time

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What does it do if you boot it without any RAM? It should at least show you the BIOS.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You only need 1 stick of RAM for it to run, put it in the slot closest to the CPU and see if it works, if not then swap out the sticks with your remaining ones until something else happens.

Thanks mitb but I have tried that, I did try to say in my first post:

thepinksock:

Still not working. Tried it with 1 stick of ram in each slot, tried with 2…

Tried everything I can diagnostically now but without my screens turning on there’s not much else I can think of to do.

Would you guys assume it’s a motherboard problem if I first started getting bsods and ended up without it even outputting to my monitors?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You only need 1 stick of RAM for it to run, put it in the slot closest to the CPU and see if it works, if not then swap out the sticks with your remaining ones until something else happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:374586”]UGH I had that BSOD for the longest time. It kept getting more and more frequent. When I had it, it was from my RAM going bad. Got that replaced by Kingston and it was smooth sailing since then.

Can you boot with a bootdisk and see if anything comes on the monitors and run tests?[/quote]
Oh yeah I also forgot to mention that while I’m home for the next 3 weeks I have left my windows 7 and windows xp disks at my university flat.

Do you think it would even work because if I put the disk in there’s no way I can even see what’s on the screen

edit - Oh and also yeah I had this bsod for a long time with my old pc too, I tried changing ram and it worked for a while but then it came back. I’m starting to think that the voltage through my wall is going a bit crazy and some how fucking with my pc. Is that even possible?

double edit - lucky I opened my portable dvd drive and sitting in there was the bootdisk for my netbook (XP). I put that in my desktop and I can hear the disk spin up but nothing happening. Tried mashing my keyboard as well a few times and that did nothing. herp.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer borked
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

UGH I had that BSOD for the longest time. It kept getting more and more frequent. When I had it, it was from my RAM going bad. Got that replaced by Kingston and it was smooth sailing since then.

Can you boot with a bootdisk and see if anything comes on the monitors and run tests?

Read full topic

wow I can feel how much you’re stressing right now… Computer rage kills.

I have a strong feeling the problem is your motherboard.

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

So here’s what happened

[ul][li]went home for christmas and took my desktop computer with me in the boot of my uncles car. It was nice and snug in there so I doubt any damage was done in transportation.[/li]
[li]Got home, hooked it all up, worked perfectly for about 2 days[/li]
[li]after being afk a few hours i came back to a normal computer, after about 5 minutes it froze up and I had to restart. Everything was fine for another 5 minutes until I got a bsod
“IRQL NOT LESS OR EQUAL”[/li]
[li]This time when i turned it on windows 7 tried to find and repair the problem, after leaving it to “repair” for an hour i decided to give up and reboot again. This time i tried to boot in to my xp partition. Got to the desktop and it blue screened again with IRQL NOT LESS OR EQUAL.
[/li][/ul]

I decide to leave it off for a few hours, perhaps it overheated. I turned it off and tried changing around my monitors diagnostically. I then took out my 8800gts and tried using default graphics but that still didn’t work. tl;dr getting black screen when turning on computer, monitors not detecting. What else can I do?

p.s. I had 12 weeks of uni, in this time I saved all the games I wanted to play until I got to Christmas vacation. Vacation comes and my pc breaks. FUCKING FUCK MY FUCKING LIFE
